title: Jordan normal form
summary:
In linear algebra, a Jordan normal form, also known as a Jordan canonical form[1]
or JCF,[2]
is an upper triangular matrix of a particular form called a Jordan matrix representing a linear operator on a finite-dimensional vector space with respect to some basis. Such a matrix has each non-zero off-diagonal entry equal toÂ 1, immediately above the main diagonal (on the superdiagonal), and with identical diagonal entries to the left and below them.
